title: Kotlin Expressions
content: Expressions consist of variables, operators etc that evaluates to a single value.
In the following example, "5 + 7" is an expression that returns Int value, "if (a > b) a else b" is also an expression.
code: max = if (a > b) a else b
highlight: In Kotlin, if is an expression unlike Java (In Java, if is a statement).

title: Kotlin Statements
content: Statements are everything that make up a complete unit of execution.
Here, "90 + 25" is an expression that returns 115, and "val score = 90 + 25;" is a statement.
